--- "Cedric Beust" <cbeust@g...> wrote:
> If you use random seeds and that the seed used is part of
> the report, it's actually possible to recreate the exact
> same series of random numbers that led to the crash.

Controlling the random number generator's seed can be a good way to 
create deterministic tests for "random" behavior.

But last time I was testing a "random" process, I found I needed more 
precise control of the random number generator, as it can be hard to 
find the magic seed values that produce the sequence of numbers I 
want.  So I put an interface between the code and the random number 
generator, and substituted a MockObject, programmed to produce 
carefully selected sequences of numbers.

See the "JeffGrigg-Magic8Ball.zip" file in the 'extremeprogramming' 
group's files section:

http://tinyurl.com/auc8o
